Question_1.Context: The study focused on investigating the metabolic variations in tea leaf metabolome of two tea cultivars over a period of five successive years.
Question_1.Question: What is the main purpose of the study?
Question_1.A: To determine the effects of shading on tea leaf metabolites
Question_1.B: To explore the impact of pruning on tea leaf metabolism
Question_1.C: To identify vintage tea products based on climatic conditions
Question_1.D: To analyze the impact of soil composition on tea leaf composition
Question_1.Source: We explored the year-to-year variations in leaf metabolome of two tea (C. sinensis) cultivars over a period of five successive years from 2015 to 2019 to determine vintage tea products, such as in grapes or wines, and showed a clear metabolic differentiations of fresh tea leaves.

Question_2.Context: The study discussed the relationship between climatic conditions and tea leaf metabolism over five successive years.
Question_2.Question: What is the significance of high rainfall under short sun exposure time for Jangwon 2 tea cultivar?
Question_2.A: It leads to inhibition of theanine metabolism
Question_2.B: It enhances the levels of EGCG3"Me
Question_2.C: It increases the levels of catechin derivatives
Question_2.D: It boosts the levels of sugars in tea leaves
Question_2.Source: High rainfall under short sun exposure time may be the best conditions for Jangwon 2 cultivar with the highest theanine amounts, and long sun exposure time for Jangwon 3 cultivar with the highest EGCG3"Me amounts.

Question_3.Context: The study highlighted the metabolic differences between Jangwon 2 and Jangwon 3 tea cultivars in response to climatic conditions.
Question_3.Question: Which metabolite was consistently more abundant in Jangwon 3 tea cultivar across the five successive years?
Question_3.Source: Notably, high amounts of EGCG3"Me in the leaves of Jangwon 3 tea cultivar were observed across five successive years, compared to those of Jangwon 2 cultivar.

Question_4.Context: The study discussed the metabolic variations in tea leaf metabolome of two tea cultivars over a period of five successive years.
Question_4.Question: What was the main finding regarding the levels of theanine in Jangwon 2 tea cultivar in 2018?
Question_4.A: The levels were positively associated with high rainfall
Question_4.B: The levels were negatively associated with long sun exposure time
Question_4.C: The levels were the lowest compared to other years
Question_4.D: The levels were the highest compared to other years
Question_4.Source: The lowest amounts of theanine were found in tea leaves of Jangwon 2 cultivar plucked in 2018.

Question_5.Context: The study focused on the metabolic differences between Jangwon 2 and Jangwon 3 tea cultivars in response to climatic conditions.
Question_5.Question: What was the main impact of drought conditions in 2019 on Jangwon 3 tea cultivar?
Question_5.A: It led to increased levels of theanine
Question_5.C: It enhanced the levels of EGCG3"Me
Question_5.D: It boosted the levels of sugars in tea leaves
Question_5.Source: Increased accumulation of EGCG3"Me, as well as catechins, EC and GC, were observed in the leaves of Jangwon 3 tea cultivar harvested in July, 2019.

Question_6.Context: The study discussed the metabolic variations in tea leaf metabolome of two tea cultivars over a period of five successive years.
Question_6.Question: What was the main difference in metabolic response between Jangwon 2 and Jangwon 3 tea cultivars towards climatic conditions?
Question_6.A: Jangwon 2 had higher levels of EGCG3"Me
Question_6.B: Jangwon 3 had higher levels of theanine
Question_6.C: Jangwon 2 was more affected by drought conditions
Question_6.D: Jangwon 3 was more affected by high rainfall
Question_6.Source: Across the five successive years, the levels of theanine, glutamine, GABA, acetate, and succinate in Jangwon 2 tea cultivar were comparatively higher than in the Jangwon 3 tea cultivar.

Question_7.Context: The study highlighted the metabolic differences between Jangwon 2 and Jangwon 3 tea cultivars in response to climatic conditions.
Question_7.Question: What was the main impact of long sun exposure time during harvesting on Jangwon 3 tea cultivar between 2015 and 2019?
Question_7.A: It led to inhibition of theanine metabolism
Question_7.B: It enhanced the levels of EGCG3"Me
Question_7.C: It increased the levels of catechin derivatives
Question_7.D: It boosted the levels of sugars in tea leaves
Question_7.Source: Long sun exposure time during harvesting was positively associated with accumulations of EGCG3"Me in Jangwon 3 tea cultivar between 2015 and 2019.

Question_8.Context: The study discussed the relationship between climatic conditions and tea leaf metabolism over five successive years.
Question_8.Question: What was the main finding regarding the levels of EGCG3"Me in Jangwon 3 tea cultivar in 2019?
Question_8.A: The levels were positively associated with high rainfall
Question_8.B: The levels were negatively associated with long sun exposure time
Question_8.C: The levels were the lowest compared to other years
Question_8.D: The levels were the highest compared to other years
Question_8.Source: Increased accumulation of EGCG3"Me, as well as catechins, EC and GC, were observed in the leaves of Jangwon 3 tea cultivar harvested in July, 2019.

Question_9.Context: The study focused on investigating the metabolic variations in tea leaf metabolome of two tea cultivars over a period of five successive years.
Question_9.Question: What was the main impact of drought conditions in 2019 on Jangwon 2 tea cultivar?
Question_9.A: It led to increased levels of theanine
Question_9.C: It enhanced the levels of EGCG3"Me
Question_9.D: It boosted the levels of sugars in tea leaves
Question_9.Source: Positive correlations between theanine levels and extreme low rainfall, close to drought, during spring of plucking season in 2019 were also observed in Jangwon 2 tea cultivar.

Question_10.Context: The study discussed the metabolic differences between Jangwon 2 and Jangwon 3 tea cultivars in response to climatic conditions.
Question_10.Question: What was the main difference in metabolic response between Jangwon 2 and Jangwon 3 tea cultivars towards climatic conditions?
Question_10.A: Jangwon 2 had higher levels of EGCG3"Me
Question_10.B: Jangwon 3 had higher levels of theanine
Question_10.C: Jangwon 2 was more affected by drought conditions
Question_10.D: Jangwon 3 was more affected by high rainfall
Question_10.Source: The lowest amounts of theanine were found in tea leaves of Jangwon 2 cultivar plucked in 2018.
